titleStmt.title: Antony Hain v. King County. Order to hold Habeas trial

bibl.title: Antony Hain v. King County. Order for Habeas Trial
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: Territory of Washington 3rd Judicial District SS
In District Court holding terms at Seattle in King County In the Matter of the Application of Anthony Han for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
To LV Wycroff, Sheriff of King County In Washington Territory, greeting:
div1.p: We command you in the name of the United States of America, that you have the body of Anthony Han, by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever cause said Anthony Han shall be, called or charged, before the Hon. J.R. Lewis, Chief Justice of Washington Territory and Judge of the 3rd Judicial District therein, at his chambers in the city of Seattle, on the 5th day of October, 1878, at 10 o'clock A.M. of that day, to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Anthony Han. And have you then and there this writ.
div1.ab: Virtues Hon. J.R. Lewis, Chief Justice of Washington Territory and Judge of said District Court and the scale thereof here affixed this 4th day of October 1878
Filed Oct of 78 James Jenny Clerk Hon. H. Chorherr
